longDef.en: one of the two parts of the body at each side of the neck that join the arms to the rest of the body

examples.en: I rested my head on her shoulder.
Then she put her arm around my shoulder and gave me a kiss.
examples.cn: 接着她用胳膊搂住我的肩，给了我一个吻。

examples.en: She glanced nervously over her shoulder to make sure no one else was listening.
examples.cn: 她不安地回头扫了一眼，以确认没有人在听。

longDef.en: the top part of a person's back

examples.en: He was about six feet tall with broad shoulders.
examples.cn: 他大约6英尺高，双肩宽阔。

examples.en: "I don't know what to do about it," said Martha, shrugging her shoulders.
examples.cn: “我不知道该如何处理这件事，”玛莎耸耸肩说道。

longDef.en: the parts of a piece of clothing that cover the wearer's shoulders

examples.en: The shoulders look a little tight. Do you want to try a larger size?
examples.cn: 肩部看上去有点儿紧。你想试试尺寸大些的吗？

longDef.en: the part of a bottle that curves out below its opening
longDef.cn: 瓶肩（瓶颈下面扩大的部分）

longDef.en: used to refer to the responsibility that someone has or feels for something

examples.en: A huge burden was lifted from my shoulders (= I became much less worried) when I told my parents about my problem.
examples.cn: 我把自己的问题告诉父母后，感到如释重负。

examples.en: Responsibility for the dispute rests squarely on the shoulders of the president.
examples.cn: 调解争端的责任完全落在了总统的肩上。

longDef.en: a piece of meat that includes the upper part of an animal's front leg
longDef.cn: （动物身上包括前腿上半部的）肩肘肉，前腿肉

examples.en: I've bought a shoulder of lamb for Sunday lunch.
examples.cn: 我买了块羊肩肘肉，用来做星期天的午餐。

longDef.en: an area along the side of a main road where cars can stop
longDef.cn: 路肩，（大路两侧的）紧急停车道

examples.en: There were tire tracks left in the soft shoulder (= area of dirt or grass by the road).
examples.cn: 在软路肩上有轮胎印子。

longDef.en: to accept that you are responsible for something bad or difficult
longDef.cn: 承受谴责／承受重负／承担职责／承担费用（等等）

examples.en: It is women who mainly shoulder responsibility for the care of elderly and disabled relatives.
examples.cn: 承担照顾老人和残疾亲属责任的主要都是女人。

examples.en: Teachers cannot be expected to shoulder all the blame for poor exam results.
examples.cn: 考试成绩不理想，责任不能全部归到老师身上。

longDef.en: to put something on your shoulders to carry it

examples.en: Shouldering her pack, she strode off up the road.

longDef.en: to push something with one of your shoulders

examples.en: She was carrying two suitcases and had to shoulder the door open.
examples.cn: 她手提着两个箱子，不得不用肩把门顶开。

examples.en: He shouldered his way (= formed a way through by pushing with his shoulders) to the front of the crowd to get a better look.
examples.cn: 他用肩膀开路挤到人群前面，以便看得更清楚。
